title: there are enough yasuo threads here to make a sweater
body:
makes it kinda hard to see the legitimate discussions going on here when the 7 bazillion yasuo threads are forming a windwall

can we talk about something else?

replies.body: i like that he's getting the negative attention i think he deserves. i'm just here to upvote for a really good pun.
I upvote your upvote and would like to start a thread on yasous flute playing.  Does anyone else think his C  minor is a tad flat?

i think its Epic

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ux7AotP9nyg

looks like its time to nerf yasuo eh

consensus says he feels like bullshit and is total bullshit and unfun to play against

only people i hear defending yasuo are yasuo players

> [{quoted}](name=magic pole,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=t33yLs2h,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-11-26T09:01:04.600+0000)
>
> looks like its time to nerf yasuo eh
> 
> consensus says he feels like bullshit and is total bullshit and unfun to play against
> 
> only people i hear defending yasuo are yasuo players

i was fine with yasuo till this patch
like i defended yasuo on the boards but this patch nonono 
100% crit with just {{item:3087}} and {{item:1018}} 
compared to old yas who needed {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3078}} or 10% crit runes
it is not very fun
You do realize they gutted Shiv this patch? Most don't build it anymore
they dropped the shiv damage by a little bit...
It's no where near as good as it was and yasuo's don't build it anymore... big nerf to him
What Yasuo's? Nearly everyone I encounter builds shiv. Even non Yasuo champs build shiv.
Because you play against unranked kids who don't read patch notes

Is everything discussed really just exclusively to ranked matches? I mean there are more than just ranked matches being played in this game. I'm not trying to denounce anything about ranked matches or ranked players but Ranked or not these changes effect the whole game. OK, so maybe Ranked is more important (for whatever reason) but that doesn't mean it should be the only part discussed. My point Is that you say that Yasuo's do not build this way but just because they may not build it as much in the games you play I am speaking from experience that they do significantly often in the games I do and bringing up rank is not a valid excuse.

Listen, I was making a point that the players you're playing against are not good at this game. They probably didn't read the patch notes, which is why they're building an item that isn't as efficient on him anymore. He has a 48% win rate currently, which used to be 54%. He has been nerfed. Not directly, but his mastery and his core item has been gutted so he has been indirectly nerfed. Those people still building shiv probably aren't good players and most definitely aren't good Yasuo players, so there's 0 reason to mention them because they are probably a free win anyways.

You mean to tell me just because someone builds a certain way or not the way the "Pro Meta" tells you to do it that makes them a bad player? I can understand a mage building ad is probably clueless on what they are doing, but Yasuo excels at crit so why would he not get an item that provides crit? OK, yes a lot of items were nerfed, but that should also tell you that Yasuo isn't the only one who got a nerf. And MAYBE, I'm not fighting good Yasuos... Maybe. But Don't you think it's kind of bs to assume a player is bad for choosing a different item that benefits them than what you would?

Shiv is just not that great anymore on him due to the damage reduction. Riot wants it to be an item you buy for wave pushing. Yasuo already has good wave pushing. A bad yasuo player would not bother switching up his building or testing out new builds. The sites that tell you what to build are usually outdated.

Like I said, his win rate dropped to 48% for a reason. It didn't happen by itself. The nerfs to shiv and his mastery dropped it

OK, but didn't all the item changes cause winrates to drop or rise on just about all champs? Didn't this update basically make it bs easy for some while making it slightly hellish for others? And while this nerf may be true Yasuo does seem to have the worst to deal with kit in the game right now With the ability to basically say "Fuck you" to range based champs AND Tower Turrets.

We're talking about Yasuo being broken and this clearly proves that he's fine after the indirect nerfs.

"AND Tower Turrets"

What does Yasuo have to do with Turrets? Are you implying that Yasuo's windwall blocks turrets? Because you clearly don't understand his kit if you are and shouldn't be calling him broken.
His windwall doesn't block turret shots

Yasuo is able to summon a shield which if timed right will be enough to negate damage one would normally get for diving in a turret. Not wind wall but the shield he is able to give to himself. I don't remember to refer to Yasuo as broken, but he does seem to have an advantage not many can beat 1v1. 

But honestly my main point was questioning what made you think people are just going to stop building shiv just because it was nerfed since, a lot of items were nerfed besides just shiv.

I legitimately think Firecannon is better than Shiv now, not only on Yasuo but just about everyone who builtShiv before. Unless you want the AoE and waveclear, I don't see you you would pick Shiv over Firecannon.

I really don't think that there's any sort of consensus one way or another. It's always the people with the strongest opinions who'll post about things on forums, and since Yasuo is a perennially hated champion like Riven, he gets more hate threads. The issue is only compounded when a change of some sort makes him stronger.

I mean, really, what do you expect? Are all the players who don't care too much either way going to log in and post about their tepid opinion? Of course not. One camp complains and the other responds. Discussions like this will usually go something like this:

>_"X CHAMPION is horse shit and here's why."_
>
>_"You're wrong and also an assbag."_

Repeat ad nauseum.

Honestly surprised that Riven threads have stopped. 

I suppose watching her get dominated in Worlds once was enough to say " Whelp the pros proved it wrong. "

A lot of people also base at least part of their claims on champion.gg statistics (not that they aren't useful, they're just mis-used a lot), and right now she's sitting at a 43-44% or so win-rate at Platinum+. If they complain now, people are just going to call them noobs, basically.

Then again.. on the boards, statistics are only useful when they're convenient to your argument.. After that, 'their win/pick rate isn't a viable metric' and all that. That's been proven more than enough times.
Playing against him in early game or late game while he's fed (who am I kidding at any given moment) just sucks and makes me wanna cry.
So what your saying is I'm not allowed give feedback on things that I deem necessary to discuss even if their are many threads talking about it? Ya no thanks

Well, it's possible to join a thread already talking about it rather than making a duplicate thread :V

If you have something new to contribute that warrants a new thread, then by all means. But duplicate threads... it's better to just bump an existing thread.

Give feedback, but don't duplicate threads is the point here.
This thread is already another duplicate saying that we should stop talking about yasuo so doesn't this add to the problem.

*raises hand*

...

*lowers hand*
http://i.imgur.com/6XorLNo.jpg
I could use a sweater.  Would make the threads productive if someone on GD could knit.
still not enough for Riot to consider Yasuo an issue apparently.
Dk if u saw his winrate drop extremely but he's go almost lower the  40 percent winrate in masters ya know we're the non scrubs play

masters are fairly irrelevant due to the low amount of games really hurting the values of any statistic. On plat+ though he´s above 51%win on average, above 54% for experienced players...so he´s doing fairly well. And even if he didnßt his kit would still be unfun to play against.

The only real balance that can be done is at the highest level because bronze think Katarina and blitz crank are broken with no counter play. And I actually checked today and sense the new patch he has a 48ish percent winrate

> [{quoted}](name=Godlike Jungle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=t33yLs2h,comment-id=0007000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-26T18:03:27.596+0000)
>
> The only real balance that can be done is at the highest level because bronze think Katarina and blitz crank are broken with no counter play. And I actually checked today and sense the new patch he has a 48ish percent winrate

Riot said they balance around plat+, masters and challengers do have the issue of an extremely low sample size leading to stuff like poppy sometimes having an 80% winrate.
But Plat plus is when yasuo win rate falls below 50 percent

> [{quoted}](name=Godlike Jungle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=t33yLs2h,comment-id=000700000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-26T20:12:46.646+0000)
>
> But Plat plus is when yasuo win rate falls below 50 percent

I wasn't here to comment on his balance, though I should point out winrate by itself doesn't mean anything, azir got nerfed while having a winrate below 50%, so did Leblanc. Pick/Ban/Supposed skillcap are important, as are winrates of people with experience (if anyone can pick up Azir and do well he's probably overtuned)

I myself haven't had problems with azir sense his release I keep trying and hoping I can get azir jungle to work but it either is a good success or ass :p. Anyway azir and leblanc have always been therotically unlikable with 4 potential dashes for leblanc there kinda more like blink and azir making an impenetrable wall. And I wasn't being aggressive I was just saying :p
I'm really sorry, but are you like 13 ;.; You always say sense and it really bugs me. IT'S SINCE* XD
Lol its just that one word THAT I CAN'T SPELL I fucking look at that word and it looks like it's in a different language xD

Yeah I've been looking up the ranks of all the Yasuo thread posters and they're all silver-gold. Why are silver and gold players so loud and ready to give their opinions on what's good in a game they suck at?

There are two sides to this, though.

The first is that silver is the majority of the playerbase, alongside bronze. But the 2nd side is that they are not as good at playing the game as their higher ranking counterparts.

So in other words, they have a right to complain, but their opinions may not be the best ones.

The only issue with him that I feel is he has the Blitzcrank syndrome. He is either overly overbearing if they know what they are doing, or utter trash and may as well not exist. That I feel is poor balance since there is no middle ground. Yes it is annoying seeing how quick he can snowball but there is more common champs that do too so that isn't to big a deal. But the issue is at least most of those champs aren't useless if they don't snowball. Darius and Garen being 2 that come to my mind immediately would love to get kills or farm if they can, but if they get beaten in the game, they have a fallback plan of being tanky, Yas doesn't have that luxury.

I would personally give him a rework so that he isn't like he is. Since as it is, he is either gutter trash, or immortal, not just he is decent.

Its because people are pissed of that Riot refuses to come out with a legitimate and specific "We are not changing him" or "We are changing him". People will continue to flood the boards with every mention of Yasuo they can until someone with authority actually says something about it. 

People have been complaining about Yasuo for months, but now with the season 6 changes he's made such an impact, especially in lower to mid ELO, that everyone has realized that he isn't a well made champion. He has no setback to his mobility, has enough of a kit to counter 70% of midlands, does not fall off, benefits so well from items, and is not an early mid or late game champion. There isn't anything really unique about him other than his ult and what people see as "big" plays. He doesn't have an identity other than pissing of gold players and below, which is something Riot came out multiple times saying that they are reworking champs to give them an "identity". 

TL;DR People wouldn't complain as much if Riot addressed the subject as an issue or not, and if they would just put out some changes on the PBE to test or consider giving Yasuo an actually identity or role, rather than nerfing Skarner and leaving Fiddlesticks to go fiddle with some sticks in the corner.
the irony that this is another thread about yasuo LOL

Then it's evident that he is enough of an annoyance or threat to the game that he warrants such attention.

If he wasn't able to outscale an entire team with two items perhaps he wouldn't be in such a spotlight.

Or it's evidence that there are a **lot** of players who haven't learned how to beat Yasuo, and don't care to learn because literally any strategy suggested will be thrown to the wind.

Like arguing with an SJW.
You make a very valid point. As someone who plays middle a fair bit, I've had to learn the hard way. It's pretty fun though, to play against a decent Yasuo and see how much I've learned.
just upvoting the pun. that was great. I disagree, I like the attention we are putting on a few of the REAL ISSUES.

Like how ppl use the word "OP" instead of "frustrating"? Or like they argumenti with "rito fix" ignoring feedback?

The only actual answers I see from suggestions about how to deal against Yasuo is "But I have to try to make such things, it's not an easy win!". Well duh.. how do youe xpect to win against a skilled player? (Because it's clear that Yasuo is a nuisance only in the right hands). And when you make them notice that so their whine is about Yasuo not being a free kill they call you biased, while anything that isn't "Yasuo hate" gets downvoted like witchcraft in the dark days.

Found the yasuo player^

"GUIS IM JUST REALLY GUD AND YOU ALL DONT KNOW HOWTO DEAL WITH THE CHAMPZ."
